_doc: GUI path-pattern presets for common frameworks. Each preset has 'patterns' (regex strings matched against step file content) and 'notes' explaining caveats. Users select a preset (or combine multiple) in their project's gui-patterns.json.

flutter.notes: Flutter: presentation/ and widgets/ are GUI-only by convention. screens/ and pages/ are typically GUI entry points. lib/shared/widgets/ is a common shared widget directory.

react.notes: React: components/ is almost always UI. pages/ and views/ are route-level UI. hooks/ is excluded (often logic-only). styles/ and css/ are pure presentation.

next.notes: Next.js: app/ route segments with page.tsx/layout.tsx are UI. components/ is UI. Note: app/ also contains route handlers (route.ts) and server actions — patterns target only known UI file conventions.

vue.notes: Vue: .vue files are single-file components (template + script + style). components/ and views/ are standard Vue CLI directories. layouts/ is used by Nuxt.

nuxt.notes: Nuxt: pages/ auto-generates routes (UI). components/ is auto-imported UI. layouts/ wraps pages. Note: server/ and composables/ are excluded (logic-only).

angular.notes: Angular: components/ are UI. Pipes and directives are presentation helpers. Note: services/ is excluded (logic-only). Angular components often live alongside their services, so patterns target the component suffix convention.

svelte.notes: Svelte/SvelteKit: routes/ contains +page.svelte and +layout.svelte (UI). lib/components/ is the standard component directory. Note: +server.ts files in routes/ are API-only — patterns target .svelte files.

swift-uikit.notes: iOS UIKit: ViewControllers, Views, Storyboards, and XIBs are GUI. Cells/ for table/collection view cells. Note: Models/ and Services/ are excluded.

swiftui.notes: SwiftUI: Views/ is the standard convention. Screens/ and Components/ are common organizational patterns. Note: Models/ and ViewModels/ are excluded (logic-only despite MVVM proximity).

android-xml.notes: Android XML layouts: res/layout/ contains XML UI definitions. res/drawable/ and res/menu/ are presentation resources. Fragments and Activities are UI controllers.

jetpack-compose.notes: Jetpack Compose: ui/ and composables/ directories contain Compose UI code. screens/ and components/ are common organizational patterns. theme/ is presentation. Note: domain/ and data/ are excluded.

django.notes: Django: templates/ contains HTML templates. static/ has CSS/JS assets. templatetags/ provides template helpers. Note: views.py may contain logic — only templates/ and static/ are safe GUI indicators.

rails.notes: Rails: app/views/ contains ERB/Haml templates. app/assets/ has stylesheets and JS. app/helpers/ assists views. Note: app/controllers/ is excluded (request handling logic).

laravel.notes: Laravel: resources/views/ contains Blade templates. resources/css/ and resources/js/ are frontend assets. Note: app/Http/Controllers/ is excluded (logic).

wpf.notes: WPF (.NET): XAML files are UI definitions. Views/ contains windows and pages. Controls/ has custom UI controls. Note: ViewModels/ is excluded (logic-only in MVVM).

qt.notes: Qt: .ui files are Qt Designer forms. .qml files are QML UI definitions. qml/ directory holds QML components. Note: .cpp models/controllers are excluded.
